value.0: I have a large inventory of magical supplies you might find useful in your travels in the Underdark, surfacer.
Goodbye, surfacer. If you find yourself in need of powerful magic, I do hope you will return.
Go ahead - ask your questions.
I know very little, though not for lack of trying. She has powerful magic under her control - some say she has bound an arch-devil to her will. In any case, my spells can learn nothing.
But I don't need my magic to know that she will destroy all who oppose her, including everyone in this camp. Of course, I already have a plan for my escape, should she fail to be stopped.
A tragic tale of lost opportunities and poorly chosen alliances. House Maeviir was once a power to be reckoned with in the great drow city of Menzoberranzan.
But House Maeviir chose to side against the Valsharess, rather than accept a subservient role as her ally. The results of that misguided decision are evident all around you.
Now it seems the long history of House Maeviir is going to come to a final and inescapable end... unless you somehow manage to stop the Valsharess and her great army.
I know she is a follower of Eilistraee, as are many of the drow with her. This makes her unpopular with many of House Maeviir's supporters... old prejudices die hard.
I, however, take a more realistic view of the current situation. House Maeviir is weak and vulnerable. We need the Seer and her drow, it is a marriage of convenience.
Of course, I don't plan to be here should this marriage end badly. If you fail to stop the Valsharess, I won't hesitate to make my escape from this doomed camp.
I'm afraid I can't help you there... though you might want to speak to Cavallas down by the docks. A strange character, but one who knows secrets even I can't fathom.
Over the years I have accumulated a significant collection of magical wares. However, with the army of the Valsharess approaching I would prefer to have my assets in a more liquid form.
Should the battle go against House Maeviir and the Seer's rebels, I want to be able to make a quick escape. And I'd rather travel with a pocket full of gold than empty-handed.
I'm a powerful wizard, but I can't turn the tide of battle alone. If I see defeat is inevitable, then why should I stay behind to be slaughtered when my magic can help me escape?
Serving House Maeviir had its privileges: power, prestige. But I can find such things in the service of any drow House whose High Wizard might happen to have an unfortunate accident.
If everyone here is going to die anyway, it only makes sense that I should try to rebuild my life and position somewhere else, doesn't it?
I'm glad you agree. Many of the Seer's followers can't accept my utilitarian philosophy. Eilistraee has twisted their mind with odd notions of loyalty and sacrifice.
I'm a drow. Did you really expect anything less? It is our cunning that has allowed us to survive - to thrive - in the Underdark.
But this is neither the time nor the place for philosophical discussions. And if Valsharess is stopped, it will all be moot anyway.
Goodbye.
I want to ask you some questions.
Do you know anything about the Valsharess?
Tell me about House Maeviir.
What do you know about the Seer?
Do you have any advice for stopping the Valsharess?
Why is a High Wizard out here hawking his wares?
I want to ask you something else.
Escape? You'd abandon everyone here?
You make a good point.
You're a deceitful, backstabbing coward!
Can you identify something for me?
Let me see your inventory.
